column4: Do you guys have any suggestions as to where I should start troubleshooting for not being able to connect to https websites?
what browser r u using
I've tried midori, chromium, firefox
same problem across the board
local cert problem?  as in certificate?  What would I do about it
do you know what program deals with ssl connections?
are you using a router?
I'm straight to my modem
I've eliminated any external fuck up.  Not my ISP, not my router, not my browser.  What else could be going wrong?
I'm thinking ipv6 could have something to do with it.  I was having some problems a while ago and disabled ipv6 in firefox.. That fixed my connection problems temporarily
now whether it's enabled or not I still have this problem
apparently I ca do some https..  I'm conneced to https://wiki.mozilla.org
what doesn't work is logging in.. be it gmail, youtube, msn
It's just me.
:-(  I don't want to reformat or worse, go back to windows because of this.  Is there some command that would reset all my networking or whatever to default?
I have a bunch of libraries for SSL
libcheroekk-mod-libssl libssl-ocaml libssl-ocaml-dev libssl0.9.8 libssl-dev
can u connect to your modem (with browser)?
not sure what you mean.
i restarted my browsers, my computer
i can connect to regular http websites
your modem has an ip address that you can enter in your browsers address field, e.g http//192.168.0.1
that's a router's address isn't it?
your modem has an address, just like a router
